title: La Borsa svizzera apre in rialzo con l'indice SMI in crescita dello 0,33%
cleaned_sentences: Investors attentive to US duties, monetary policy of the Fed and Russia-Ukraine interviews Positive opening this morning for the Swiss stock exchange.
Shortly after 9.00 the SMI Guide Pitting Index marked a progression of 0.33% to 12'267.79 points.
On the markets, investors look at the developments of American commercial policy, in particular the duties in China and Europe.
In the spotlight also the moves of the Fed on the monetary policy front, as well as the talks between Russia and Ukraine to end the conflict.
Day of technical deadlines in Europe and USA where future are contrasted.
The other main European squares have also opened up: Paris gains 0.27%, Frankfurt 0.34%, London 0.40%and Milan 0.30%.
Tokyo concluded the unchanged session, with the Nikkei index at 37'753 points.

The contrasted closure of Wall Street and the data of the Japanese GDP is weighed, who in the first quarter contracted for the first time in a year, more than the expectations, due to the drop in exports.
The Dow Jones gained 0.65% to 42'322.75 points, the Nasdaq lost 0.18% to 19'112.32 points, while the S&P 500 advanced by 0.42% to 5'916.93 points.
